Sokaraja is a small town located close to the city of
, it called as the commuter city. It is also a transit place for the people who want to go to some major cities such as

From capital city of Jakarta through Sukarno Hatta Airport, you can pass Adi Sucipto Airport (Yogyakarta), Adi Sumarmo Airport (Solo), Tunggul Wulung Airstrip (Cilacap) and Ahmad Yani International Airport (Semarang) and then go through road way.
from:
Although Sokaraja doesn't have any bus station, there are a lot of buses that pass through this town from various major cities. There are also regular services to various major cities, including
(9 hours) with customer recommended Sinar Jaya bus,
(4 to 5.5 hours) with Raharja and Efisiensi bus,
(6 to 8 hours) with Budiman and Goodwill bus. The tickets are usually sell in the bus pool. If you're looking for more bus destination around the nation, head to the
There are a lot of trains from major cities of the island to
Railway Station, then go by road to Sokaraja.
Sokaraja is a small town. The town's core is located along the Jalan Jenderal Sudirman and Jalan Gatot Subroto. You can walk through town in only 20 minutes.
Traditional three-wheeled pedal-powered carts known as 'becak'. Very common in Indonesia.
The F2 Angkot serves direct route from Sokaraja to Purwokerto.

value: in the Depo Pelita (Jalan Menteri Supeno no. 10) is a newly-built and the only waterpark in town. Although not really big, this waterpark is visited mostly on Sundays and holidays.

The largest traditional market in town is Pasar Sokaraja.

Sokaraja is famous for its local snacks.

value: directions=There are a lot of Getuk Goreng Asli H. Tohirin stores, especially along the Jalan Jend. Sudirman

There are a lot of other snack stores in Sokaraja that you may check it out one by one. Mainly, snack stores are located along Jalan Jend. Sudirman.
Sokaraja is also a culinary city. The typical dish of Purwokerto is Soto Sokaraja. There are plenty of soto stores along the Jalan Jend. Sudirman.
